channel.title: Anubhav Prasai - Essays & Reflections
channel.description: Longform essays on philosophy, technology, attention, and the examined life. Minimal design, maximum depth.

item.title: On the Nature of Time and Memory
item.description: Time moves in strange ways through our consciousness. This essay explores how memory reshapes our perception of past events and why nostalgia feels simultaneously real and illusory.

item.title: Digital Minimalism as Practice
item.description: In an age of infinite content and perpetual connectivity, choosing what not to consume becomes a radical act. Reflections on attention, intention, and the quiet spaces we've lost.

item.title: Learning to See Again
item.description: On recovering the capacity for genuine attention in a world engineered to capture and commodify it. An exploration of presence, perception, and the art of noticing.

item.title: The Tyranny of Productivity
item.description: What if rest isn't a reward for productivity, but a precondition for meaning? Challenging the cult of optimization and recovering a more humane relationship with time.

item.title: On Solitude and Loneliness
item.description: Two states often confused but fundamentally different. An examination of what it means to be alone by choice versus alone by circumstance, and why both matter.
